item.title: New sign still wobbling, 14th January
item.description:
I previously reported new one way sign as it fell over. However the replacement doesn’t seem to have been done to a high standard - the hole is filled in with sand/gravel rather than concrete and the pole is therefore still wobbling. Unsafe!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street light, 14th January
item.description:
There is no street light between Clydesdale and Normal Road in Belvedere, near Starbucks. As a woman this is quite difficult because I walk through these roads to get to my gym, especially during winter when it is pitch black in the afternoon. The lamps are there, there's just no lights. Kindly requesting for these to be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clydesdale Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping, 14th January
item.description:
Hello, someone has dumped what looks like their whole living room on the corner near the garages, blocking the path. Please can it be collected. Can some sort of CCTV be placed there too? You’d make an absolute killing from it. Thank you

item.title: Overhanging branches from garden, 14th January
item.description:
In the winter the branches are low hanging and sharp (less than 1.8meters) and I've been caught in the face a couple of times. In the summer they let it grow so much that people have to walk on the road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Crooms Hill, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped van parked on pavement, 14th January
item.description:
Silver and orange van has been dumped on pavement of balliol road since before Christmas. The windscreen is smashed where they have removed the vin number and there are no number plates. An enforcement sticker has been put on it since before Christmas giving the owners 7 days to remove it... that was weeks ago and nothing has been done
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Balliol Road, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, 14th January
item.description:
So can whoever responded to previous notifications about this issue - saying it's Thames Water's responsibility - check whether they have logged the issue with the right asset? I attach two photos. The first photo shows the offending manhole cover which only says 'Highway' on it. The second photo of a manhole cover slightly up the road on Royal Hill (and causing no issue) clearly says TWA - Thames Water Authority. There is no indication that the manhole we are all having an issue with belongs to TWA. Nor does it look like any of the manhole covers shown on their website: https://www.thameswater.co.uk/help/water-and-waste-help/manhole-covers. The only ones that look vaguely similar have some kind of Thames Water branding on it., unlike the one I've sent you a photo of. Would Thames Water have two manhole covers so close together? Is it possible that TW haven't fixed it because you've incorrectly told them it's theirs?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwich High Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
